author: sky.cactus
content: Miners will see transactions, and build a block with them.  During that time, they'll mine empty blocks, and continually rebase the long-block on top of the empty blocks until *eventually* someone manages to finish processing it (just due to Poisson distribution of block times resulting in a random long time between blocks).  Once the block is mined it will propagate to other miners who will start processing it and mine empty blocks while they do.  Eventually they'll finish processing and start mining non-empty blocks again (which may be another attacker block).

author: sky.cactus
content: The problem here of course is that all of those empty blocks are reducing the *effective* gas limit, which will increase congestion.

author: sky.cactus
content: 1559 would actually alleviate this problem *slightly* because it will result in block elasticity expanding to counteract the empty blocks, so we'll eventually hit the target (unless the attacker can sustain the attack indefinitely).
